result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Does not take effect until 11-04-22. Pictures and Prints. No Contact with A.G.A. or their residence.
Order converting Cash Bond to Signature

10:49 AM Defendant SHAWN W. HAMM appeared by video from work release
 Prosecuting attorney Mark s Williams in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Eligible for PD, no attorney yet.  Need to reschedule.  
Request bond reduction.  Defendant would like to waive his right to an attorney also.  Judge gives right to an attorney.  Waive right to an attorney.  
Defendant would like to enter Guilty.  
Defendant is requesting high signature bond.  State believes he is on probation.  Long criminal record.  State requests we schedule Plea and sentencing quickly.  
State opposes any reduction of the bond.    Defendant informs the court he is not on probation.  Judge denies the motion to reduce at this time.  
Bond continues with all conditions.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:15 am.
filed by defendant - sent to Branch 2
